Technical info of chassis. Car is a series produced Formula Ford racer converted for road use that including the addition of registration plates, wheel covers, front and rear lights, revised wing mirrors and a horn. The car was driven on road-legal tyres. Ford conducted test.
Toyota Motorsport GmbH conducted test.

Time was set on a non-exclusive public track day with other cars present. Car has been modified by Loaded to include a custom supercharger that puts out 180Â PS (132Â kW; 178Â hp) more than the stock car's 360Â PS (265Â kW; 355Â hp) 3.2L inline 6 BMW S54 engine. Car is road legal outside of North America.
Claimed by August Achleitner, 911 Series Manager, in Car & Driver August 2011 Edition. Time is for non-production, Prototype Porsche (Type 991) Carrera S in its "best configuration".
Car wasn't road legal. A manual stopwatch in a promotional video by Jaguar was shown displaying this time. Not independently verified.

Refer to link for modification details. Modified by Japanese automotive accessory company Blitz, it was claimed to be capable of 750Â PS (552Â kW; 740Â hp) but ran on 606Â bhp (452Â kW; 614Â PS) when time was recorded.
BMW M70 S70B56 engine from a V12 LMR.

"...we cant resist asking what its lap time is and Richter, (Gerhard Richter, director of M GmbH) reveals that it's 8:15, but that time was set with a development car rather than the final, optimum, production-ready car."
Bodykit with wing, 21" wheels, wider tyres, lowered suspension.

Electric RaceAbout of Finland is road legal and registered prototype battery electric vehicle. Test was run by Helsinki Metropolia University of Applied Sciences using Nokian Z G2 high performance road tyres.[392] Time will also be verified and published by Sport Auto.

Chery conducted test. This modified car differs from the production model with added roll-cage, stripped out interior, upgraded brakes, rims and tyres. Not clear whether the engine had been tuned. Chery claimed that they have been the first Chinese auto maker that 'Conquered the Nurburgring (ä¸­å›½é¦–é©±ï¼Œå¾æœçº½åšæ ¼æž—ï¼)'.
Sabine Schmitz set this lap on her first try after telling Jeremy Clarkson that his time in the Jaguar of 9:59 was rubbish.
This was the first time under ten minutes recorded by an electric car.

Clarkson was set a challenge to get a Jaguar S-Type 2.7 Diesel round the 'ring in under 10 minutes, and after getting shown around and getting advice from Sabine Schmitz, and quite a few attempts, he managed a 9:59. Sabine went on to say that she could do this lap time in a van. She completed the lap in the same car as Clarkson in 9:12.

After telling Jeremy Clarkson that she could do his lap time in a van, Schmitz was set the same challenge as Clarkson, but in a Ford Transit. After a few attempts, she found this was impossible, so she had to strip some weight out of the van and have a Dodge Viper drive in front of it for slipstream. Vehicle had several parts removed and the draft vehicle in front of it for the 10:08 lap time. Top Gear Series 6, Episode 7. Originally aired 10 July 2005[397]
